# Arpeggio: 13th in B (Shape: D)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played in sequence, instead of simultaneously. The 13th in B arpeggio is based on the note B using the D shape on the guitar.

## Notes and Intervals:
- B (root)
- D# (major 3rd)
- F# (perfect 5th)
- A# (major 7th)
- E (major 13th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
This arpeggio has a jazzy, sophisticated sound due to the inclusion of the major 7th and major 13th intervals. It is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and R&B genres to add color and complexity to chord progressions and solos.

## Songs:
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis**: This jazz classic features arpeggios and modal improvisation, including the 13th in B arpeggio.
2. **"Spain" by Chick Corea**: A fusion jazz masterpiece where arpeggios, including the 13th in B, are used extensively throughout the composition.
3. **"Neo Soul Backing Track in B Minor"**: This backing track is a great example of how the 13th in B arpeggio can be used in a modern R&B and neo-soul context.
